program an erosion and sediment control plan at the option of the applicant may be submitted to the board for review and approval rather than to each jurisdiction concerned where the landdisturbing activity results from the construction of a singlefamily residence an agreement in lieu of a plan may be substituted for an erosion and sediment control plan if executed by the planapproving authority b the standards are contained within the virginia erosion and sediment control regulations and the virginia erosion and sediment control handbook and are to be used by the applicant when making a submittal under the provisions of this chapter and in the preparation of an erosion and sediment control plan the planapproving authority in considering the adequacy of a submitted plan shall be guided by the same standards regulations and guidelines c the planapproving authority shall review conservation plans submitted to it and grant written approval within sixty 60 days of the receipt of the plan if it determines that the plan meets the requirements of the boards regulations and if the person responsible for carrying out the plan certifies that he will properly perform the conservation measures included in the plan and will conform to the provisions of this article in addition as a prerequisite to engaging in the landdisturbing activities shown on the approved plan the person responsible for carrying out the plan shall provide to the program authority the name of an individual holding a certificate of competence as provided by 52 of the virginia who will be in charge of and responsible for carrying out the landdisturbing activity failure to provide the name of an individual holding a certificate of competence prior to engaging in landdisturbing activities may result in revocation of the approval of the plan and the person responsible for carrying out the plan shall be subject to the penalties provided in this article however the vescp authority may waive the certificate of competence requirement for an agreement in lieu of a plan for construction of a singlefamily residence if a violation occurs during the landdisturbing activity then the person responsible for carrying out the agreement in lieu of a plan shall correct the violation and provide the name of an individual holding a certificate of competence as provided by 52 of the virginia failure to provide the name of an individual holding a certificate of competence shall be a violation of this article d the planapproving authority shall act upon the plan within fortyfive 45 days from receipt thereof by either approving said plan in writing or by disapproving said plan in writing and giving specific reasons for its disapproval when the plan is determined to be inadequate the planapproving authority shall specify such modifications terms and conditions that will permit approval of the plan if no action is taken within fortyfive 45 days the plan shall be deemed approved and the person authorized to proceed with the proposed activity e the vescp authority shall act on any erosion and sediment control plan that has been previously disapproved within fortyfive 45 days after the plan has been revised resubmitted for approval and deemed adequate f the vescp authority may require changes to an approved plan when 1 the inspection reveals that the plan is inadequate to satisfy applicable regulations  or 2 the person responsible for carrying out the plan finds that because of changed circumstances or for other reasons the approved plan cannot be effectively carried out and proposed amendments to the plan consistent with the requirements of this article are agreed to by the planapproving authority and the person responsible for carrying out the plans g the planapproving authority may waive or modify any of the standards that are deemed to be inappropriate or too restrictive for site conditions by granting a variance a variance may be granted under the following conditions 1 at the time of plan submission an applicant may request a variance to become part of the approved erosion and sediment control plan the applicant shall explain in writing the reasons for requesting a variance specific variances which are allowed by the planapproving authority shall be documented in the plan 2 during construction the person responsible for implementing the approved plan may request in writing a variance from the planapproving authority the planapproving authority shall respond in writing either approving or disapproving the request if the planapproving authority does not approve a variance within ten 10 days following receipt of the request the request shall be considered disapproved following disapproval the applicant may resubmit a variance request with additional documentation 3 the vescp authority shall consider variance requests judiciously keeping in mind both the need of the applicant to maximize cost effectiveness and the need to protect offsite properties and resources from damage h in order to prevent further erosion the director or designee may require approval of a plan for any land identified in the citys vescp as an erosion impact area i when landdisturbing activity will be required of a contractor performing construction work pursuant to a construction contract the preparation submission and approval of an specified violations arising from the same operative set of facts result in civil penalties which exceed a total of three thousand dollars $300000 except that a series of violations arising from the person engaging in or proposing to engage in landdisturbing activities  71514  a  1 4516 secs 810 811  reserved article iii  stormwater management and control division 1  generally generally a this article shall be known as the stormwater management and control ordinance for the city of manassas park hereafter referred to as the ordinance b the purpose of this ordinance is to ensure the general health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city of manassas park and protect the quality and quantity of state waters from the potential harm of unmanaged stormwater including protection from a landdisturbing activity causing unreasonable degradation of properties water quality stream channels and other natural resources and to establish procedures whereby stormwater requirements related to water quality and quantity shall be administered and enforced c this ordinance is issued under the authority of  62144 et seq of the virginia the virginia stormwater management act and their attendant regulations as adopted by the virginia soil and water conservation board authority to protect water quality is also provided by  1522283 of the virginia virginia  62144 specifically requires the city to adopt a virginia stormwater management program d the city of manassas park the city requires the design development improvement operation maintenance and monitoring of a system of manmade and natural components of stormwater management infrastructure to both limit and manage the volume of stormwater thereby controlling flood events and preventing degradation of the citys waterways and erosion of the citys lands quality and quantity management e the city is subject to the federal clean water acts national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permit program for stormwater discharges in order to comply with npdes requirements the city must develop a stormwater management program to reduce stormwater pollution from the drainage system f stormwater runoff is associated with all developed properties in the city whether residential or nonresidential and the individual property impacts of runoff are directly related to the amount of impervious surface on the property g stormwater management infrastructure provides benefits and services to properties within the city that have impervious areas by directly protecting such properties control of flooding and reduces the impact of stormwater flow on the citys natural environment h the costs of designing developing improving maintaining operating and monitoring the stormwater system required in the city both to meet federal state and local laws and regulations and to address identified flood event needs should be allocated to the extent practicable to all property owners based on the impact to the stormwater management system of runoff from the impervious areas of owners respective properties i the citys governing body is required by state law to adopt a program for long range stormwater management and control and is authorized to set fees to fund that program establishment of the stormwater management and control program and its funding pursuant to this article is necessary to provide for the general health safety and welfare of the city and its residents j the provisions of this article shall be deemed severable and if any of the provisions hereof are adjudged to be invalid or unenforceable the remaining portions of this article shall remain in full force and effect  71514  b  2 4516 definitions in addition to the definitions set forth in 9vac2587010 of the virginia  technical criteria for regulated landdisturbing activities water quality design criteria requirements a in order to protect the quality of state waters and to control the discharge of stormwater pollutants from regulated activities the following minimum design criteria and statewide standards for stormwater management shall be applied to the site 1 new development the total phosphorus load of new development projects shall not exceed 041 pounds per acre per year as calculated pursuant to section 822 2 development on prior developed lands i for landdisturbing activities disturbing greater than or equal to one 1 acre that result in no net increase in impervious cover from the predevelopment condition the total phosphorus load shall be reduced at least twenty 20 percent below the predevelopment total phosphorus load ii for regulated landdisturbing activities disturbing less than one 1 acre that result in no net increase in impervious cover from the predevelopment condition the total phosphorus load shall be reduced at least ten 10 percent below the predevelopment total phosphorus load iii for landdisturbing activities that result in a net increase in impervious cover over the predevelopment condition the design criteria for new development shall be applied to the increased impervious area depending on the area of disturbance the criteria of subdivisions i or ii above shall be applied to the remainder of the site iv in lieu of subdivision iii of this subsection the total phosphorus load of a linear development project occurring on prior developed lands shall be reduced twenty 20 percent below the predevelopment total phosphorus load b compliance with subsection a of this section shall be determined in accordance with section 822 c nothing in this section shall prohibit the administrator from establishing more stringent requirements to comply with the citys ms4 permit or tmdl requirements  71514 water quality compliance a compliance with the water objectives  or ii the peak discharge requirements for concentrated stormwater flow to natural stormwater conveyance systems in subdivision 3 of this subsection shall be met 3 natural stormwater activity shall be calculated either i in accordance with the following methodology q developed   ifq predeveloped  rv predeveloped rv developed under no condition shall q developed be greater than q predeveloped nor shall q developed be required to be less than that calculated in the equation q forest  rv forest rv developed   where if improvement factor equals 08 for sites > 1 acre or 09 for sites   1 acre q developed   the allowable peak flow rate of runoff from the developed site rv developed   the volume of runoff from the site in the developed condition q predeveloped   the peak flow forested condition rv forest   the volume of runoff from the site in a forested condition  or ii in accordance with another methodology that is demonstrated by the administrator to achieve equivalent results and is approved by the state water control board 4 limits of analysis unless subdivision 3 of this subsection is utilized to show compliance with the channel protection criteria stormwater conveyance systems shall be analyzed for compliance with channel protection criteria to a point where either i based on land area the sites contributing drainage area is less than or equal to 10% of the total watershed area  or ii based on peak flow rate the sites peak flow rate from the oneyear 24hour storm is less than or equal to 10% of the existing peak flow rate from the oneyear 24hour storm prior to the implementation of any stormwater quantity control measures c flood protection concentrated stormwater flow shall be released into a stormwater conveyance system and shall meet one of the following criteria as demonstrated by use of acceptable hydrologic and hydraulic methodologies 1 concentrated stormwater flow to stormwater conveyance systems that currently do not experience localized flooding during the 10year 24hour storm event the point of discharge releases stormwater into a stormwater conveyance system that following the landdisturbing activity confines the postdevelopment peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event within the stormwater conveyance system detention of stormwater or downstream improvements may be incorporated into the approved landdisturbing activity to meet this criterion at the discretion of the administrator 2 concentrated stormwater flow to stormwater conveyance systems that currently experience localized flooding during the 10year 24hour storm event the point of discharge either i confines the postdevelopment peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event within the stormwater conveyance system to avoid the localized flooding detention of stormwater or downstream improvements may be incorporated into the approved landdisturbing activity to meet this criterion at the discretion of the administrator  or ii releases a postdevelopment peak flow rate for the 10year 24hour storm event that is less than the predevelopment peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event unless required by the administrator downstream stormwater conveyance systems do not require any additional analysis to show compliance with flood protection criteria if this option is utilized 3 limits of analysis unless subdivision 2ii of this subsection is utilized to comply with the flood protection criteria stormwater conveyance systems shall be analyzed for compliance with flood protection criteria to a point where i the sites contributing drainage area is less than or equal to 10% of the total watershed area draining to a point of analysis in the downstream stormwater conveyance system  ii based on peak flow rate the sites peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event is less than or equal to 10% of the existing peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event prior to the implementation of any stormwater quantity control measures  or iii the stormwater conveyance system enters a mapped floodplain or other floodprone area adopted by ordinance or any locality d the post development peak flow for the 2year 24hour storm event shall be released at a rate that is equal to or less than the predevelopment peak flow rate from the 2year 24hour storm event and the post development peak flow for the 10year 24hour storm event shall be released at a rate that is less than or equal to the predevelopment peak flow rate from the 10year 24hour storm event e increased volumes of sheet flow resulting from pervious or disconnected impervious areas or from physical spreading of concentrated flow spreaders must be identified and evaluated for potential impacts on downgradient properties or resources increased volumes of sheet flow that will cause or contribute to erosion sedimentation or flooding of down gradient properties or resources shall be diverted to a stormwater management facility or a stormwater conveyance system that conveys the runoff without causing downgradient erosion sedimentation or flooding if all runoff from the site is sheet flow and the conditions of this subsection are met no further water quantity controls are required f for purposes of computing predevelopment runoff all pervious lands on the site shall be assumed to be in good hydrologic condition in accordance with the us department of agricultures natural resources conservation service nrcs standards regardless of conditions existing at the time of computation predevelopment runoff calculations utilizing other hydrologic conditions may be utilized provided that it is demonstrated to and approved by the administrator that actual site conditions warrant such considerations g predevelopment and post development runoff characteristics and site hydrology shall be verified by site inspections topographic surveys available soil mapping or studies and calculations consistent with good engineering practices guidance provided in the virginia stormwater management handbook and on the virginia stormwater bmp clearinghouse website shall be considered appropriate practices  71514 offsite compliance following meanings unless the context clearly indicates otherwise adequate channel means a channel that will convey the designated frequency storm event without overtopping the channel bank nor causing erosive damage to the channel bed or banks aquatic bench means a 10foot to 15foot wide bench around the inside perimeter of a permanent pool that ranges in depth from zero 0 to twelve 12 inches vegetated with emergent plants the bench augments pollutant removal provides habitats conceals trash and water level fluctuations and enhances safety average land cover condition means a measure of the average amount of impervious surfaces within a watershed assumed to be sixteen 16 percent or a calculated watershedspecific value for the average land cover condition as approved by the chesapeake bay local assistance board prior to  bioretention basin means a water quality bmp engineered to filter the water quality volume i engineered planting bed consisting of a vegetated surface layer vegetation mulch ground cover planting soil and sand bed and ii into the insitu material bioretention filter means a bioretention basin with the addition of a sand filter collector pipe system beneath the planting bed constructed wetlands means areas intentionally designed and created to emulate the water quality improvement function of wetlands for the primary purpose of removing pollutants from stormwater development means a tract of land developed or to be developed as a unit under single ownership or unified control which is to be used for any business or industrial purpose or is to contain three 3 or more residential dwelling units grassed swale means an earthen conveyance system which is broad and shallow with erosion resistant grasses and check dams engineered to remove pollutants from stormwater runoff by filtration infiltration into the soil infiltration facility means a stormwater management facility that temporarily impounds runoff and discharges it via infiltration surrounding soil while an infiltration facility may also be equipped with an outlet structure to discharge impounded runoff such discharge is normally reserved for overflow and other emergency conditions since an infiltration facility impounds runoff only temporarily it is normally dry during nonrainfall periods infiltration basin infiltration trench infiltration dry well and porous pavement shall be considered infiltration facilities nonpoint source pollutant runoff load or pollutant discharge means the average amount of a particular pollutant measured in pounds per year delivered in a diffuse manner by stormwater runoff planning area means a designated portion of the parcel on which the land development project is located planning areas shall be established by delineation on a master plan once established planning areas shall be applied consistently for all future projects sand filter means a contained bed of sand that acts to filter the first flush of runoff the runoff is then collected beneath the sand bed and conveyed to an adequate discharge point or infiltrated into the insitu soils shallow marsh means a zone within a stormwater extended detention basin that exists from the surface of the normal pool to a depth of six 6 to eighteen 18 inches and has a large surface area and therefore requires a reliable source of baseflow groundwater supply or a sizeable drainage area to maintain the desired water surface elevations to support emergent vegetation stormwater detention basin or detention basin means a stormwater management facility that temporarily impounds runoff and discharges it hydraulic outlet structure to a downstream conveyance system while a certain amount of outflow may also occur via infiltration surrounding soil such amounts are negligible when compared to the outlet structure discharge rates and are therefore not considered in the facilitys design since a detention facility impounds runoff only temporarily it is normally dry during nonrainfall periods stormwater extended detention basin or extended detention basin means a stormwater management facility that temporarily impounds runoff and discharges it hydraulic outlet structure over a specified period of time to a downstream conveyance system for the purpose of water quality enhancement or stream channel erosion control while a certain amount of outflow may also occur via infiltration surrounding soil such amounts are negligible when compared to the outlet structure discharge rates and therefore are not considered in the facilitys design since an extended detention basin impounds runoff only temporarily it is normally dry during nonrainfall periods stormwater extended detention basinenhanced or extended detention basinenhanced means an extended detention basin modified to increase pollutant removal by providing a shallow marsh in the lower stage of the basin stormwater retention basin or retention basin means a stormwater management facility that includes a permanent impoundment or normal pool of water for the purpose of enhancing water quality and therefore is normally wet even during nonrainfall periods storm runoff inflows may be temporarily stored above this permanent impoundment for the purpose of reducing flooding or stream channel erosion stormwater retention basin i or retention basin i means a retention basin with the volume of the permanent pool equal to three 3 times the water quality volume stormwater retention basin ii or retention basin ii means a retention basin with the volume of the permanent pool equal to four 4 times the water quality volume stormwater retention basin iii or retention basin iii means a retention basin with the volume of the permanent pool equal to four 4 times the water quality volume with the addition of an aquatic bench vegetated filter strip means a densely vegetated section of land engineered to accept runoff as overland sheet flow from upstream development it shall adopt any natural vegetated form from grassy meadow to small forest the vegetative cover facilitates pollutant removal sediment deposition infiltration and absorption and is dedicated for that purpose water quality volume means the volume equal to the first onehalf 12 inch of runoff multiplied by the impervious surface of the land development project  71514 applicability this part specifies the technical criteria for regulated landdisturbing activities that are not subject to the technical criteria of division 2 in accordance with section 816  71514 general a determination of flooding and channel erosion impacts to receiving streams due to landdisturbing activities shall be measured at each point of discharge from the land disturbance and such determination shall include any runoff from the balance of the watershed that also contributes to that point of discharge b the specified design storms shall be defined as either a 24hour storm using the rainfall distribution recommended by the us department of agricultures natural resources conservation service nrcs when using nrcs methods or as the storm of critical duration that produces the greatest required storage volume at the site when using a design method such as the modified rational method c for purposes of computing runoff all pervious lands in the site shall be assumed prior to development to be in good condition if the lands are pastures lawns or parks with good cover if the lands are woods or with conservation treatment if the lands are cultivated  regardless of conditions existing at the time of computation d construction of stormwater management facilities or modifications to channels shall comply with all applicable laws regulations and ordinances evidence of approval of all necessary permits shall be presented e stormwater management wet ponds and extended detention ponds that are not covered by the impounding structure regulations 4vac5020 shall at a minimum be engineered for structural integrity for the 100year storm event f predevelopment and postdevelopment runoff rates shall be verified by calculations that are consistent with good engineering practices g outflows from a stormwater management facility or stormwater conveyance system shall be discharged to an adequate channel h proposed residential commercial or industrial subdivisions shall apply these stormwater management criteria to the land disturbance as a whole individual lots in new subdivisions shall not be considered separate landdisturbing activities but rather the entire subdivision shall be considered a single land development project hydrologic parameters shall reflect the ultimate land disturbance and shall be used in all engineering calculations i all stormwater management facilities shall have an inspection and maintenance plan that identifies the owner and the responsible party for carrying out the inspection and maintenance plan j construction of stormwater management impoundment structures within a federal emergency management agency fema designated 100year floodplain shall be avoided whenever possible when this is unavoidable all stormwater management facility construction shall be in compliance with all applicable regulations under the national flood insurance program 44 cfr k natural channel characteristics shall be preserved to the maximum extent practicable l landdisturbing activities shall comply with the virginia erosion and sediment control law and attendant regulations m flood control and stormwater management facilities that drain or treat water from multiple development projects or from a significant portion of a watershed may be allowed in resource protection areas defined in the chesapeake bay preservation act provided such facilities are allowed and constructed in accordance with the stormwater management act and this chapter and provided that i the local government has conclusively established that the location of the facility within the resource protection area is the optimum location  ii the size of the facility is the minimum necessary to provide necessary flood control stormwater treatment or both  iii the facility must be consistent with a comprehensive stormwater management plan developed and approved in accordance with 9vac2587092 or with a vsmp that has been approved prior to  by the board the chesapeake bay local assistance board prior to its abolishment on  or the board of conservation and recreation  iv all applicable permits for construction in state or federal waters must be obtained from the appropriate state and federal agencies such as the us army corps of engineers the department and the virginia marine resources commission  v approval must be received from the local government prior to construction  and vi routine maintenance is allowed to be performed on such facilities to assure that they continue to function as designed n it is not the intent of this subdivision to allow a best management practice that collects and treats runoff from only an individual lot or some portion of the lot to be located within a resource protection area  71514 water quality a compliance with the water quality criteria may be achieved by applying the performancebased criteria or the technologybased criteria to either the site or a planning area b performancebased criteria for landdisturbing activities the calculated postdevelopment nonpoint source pollutant runoff load shall be compared to the calculated predevelopment load based upon the average land cover condition or the existing site condition a bmp shall be located designed and maintained to achieve the target pollutant removal efficiencies specified in table 1 of this section to effectively reduce the pollutant load to the required level based upon the following four applicable land development situations for which the performance criteria apply 1 situation 1 consists of landdisturbing activities where the existing percent impervious cover is less than or equal to the average land cover condition and the proposed improvements will create a total percent impervious cover that is less than the average land cover condition requirement no reduction in the after disturbance pollutant discharge is required 2 situation 2 consists of landdisturbing activities where the existing percent impervious cover is less than or equal to the average land cover condition and the proposed improvements will create a total percent impervious cover that is greater than the average land cover condition requirement the pollutant discharge after disturbance shall not exceed the existing pollutant discharge based on the average land cover condition 3 situation 3 consists of landdisturbing activities where the existing percent impervious cover is greater than the average land cover condition requirement the pollutant discharge after disturbance shall not exceed i the pollutant discharge based on existing conditions less ten 10 percent or ii the pollutant discharge based on the average land cover condition whichever is greater 4 situation 4 consists of landdisturbing activities where the existing percent impervious cover is served by an existing stormwater management bmp that addresses water quality requirement the pollutant discharge after disturbance shall not exceed the existing pollutant discharge based on the existing percent impervious cover while served by the existing bmp the existing bmp shall be shown to have been designed and constructed in accordance with proper design standards and specifications and to be in proper functioning condition c technologybased criteria for landdisturbing activities the postdeveloped stormwater runoff from the impervious cover shall be treated by an appropriate bmp establishment of stormwater management fund a the program is established and the stormwater management system is provided to protect the waterways and land in the city by controlling flooding and to protect the citys natural environment the costs of designing developing improving operating maintaining repairing and monitoring the stormwater system required in the city should therefore be allocated to the extent practicable to each property owner based on the propertys impact on the stormwater system in order to provide revenue to fund those costs and to fairly allocate those costs the citys governing body has established the fund b all revenues collected from the stormwater management fee or otherwise received by the city pursuant to this article shall be deposited to the fund the citys governing body may make additional appropriations to the fund all disbursements from the fund shall be for the purposes of the fund as set forth in section 846 of this article  71514 purposes of the fund the fund shall be used only for the following purposes a the acquisition by gift purchase or condemnation of real and personal property and interest therein necessary to construct operate and maintain stormwater control facilities b all costs of administration and implementation of the program to including the establishment of reasonable operating and capital reserves to meet unanticipated or emergency stormwater management requirements c engineering and design debt retirement construction costs for new facilities and enlargement or improvement of existing facilities d facility maintenance e monitoring of stormwater control devices f pollution control and abatement consistent with state and federal regulations for water pollution control and abatement g planning design land acquisition construction operation and maintenance activities  71514 administration of the fund a the citys governing body shall budget and appropriate for the fund annually b the fund shall be managed in accordance with the purposes set forth in this article c all revenues collected from fees imposed pursuant to section 848 of this article shall be deposited into the fund  71514 stormwater management fee a there is hereby imposed a service charge on property in the city on the basis set forth in this article to fund the costs of operating the stormwater management program as set forth in section 849 of this article this service charge shall be known as the stormwater management fee the fee b the fee shall be paid by the owner of each parcel of developed property in the city c the base rate will be established annually by the citys governing body the base rate shall be calculated to insure adequate revenues to provide for a balanced operation maintenance repair and capital improvements budget for the program d the fee is based on 1 the extent to which each property creates a need for the stormwater management system 2 the amount of impervious area on each property 3 the costs of implementing the program the fee shall be imposed effective   71514 classification of property for purposes of determination of the stormwater management fee a for purposes of determining the stormwater management fee all properties in the city are classified into one 1 of the following classes 1 developed residential property 2 developed nonresidential property or 3 undeveloped property b singlefamily detached residential properties will be charged the base rate for each dwelling unit regardless of the size of the parcel or the improvements townhouses and condominium units will be charged a flat rate of seventyfive 75 percent of the base rate for each dwelling unit c the annual fee for developed nonresidential property shall be the base rate multiplied by the numerical factor obtained by dividing the total impervious area of the property by one 1 base unit two thousand five hundred 2500 square feet the numerical factor will be rounded to the nearest tenth of a unit the minimum stormwater management fee for any developed property shall equal the base rate d the annual fee for vacant developed property both residential and nonresidential shall be the same as that for occupied property of the same class e commercially owned apartment property shall be treated as developed nonresidential property for the purpose of assessing the annual fee f undeveloped property shall be exempt from the fee g the fee shall not be billed for properties owned by the city including public roads or by a federal state or local government agency when that agency owns and provides for maintenance of storm drainage and stormwater control facilities  71514 adjustments a adjustments or reductions of the fee can be made upon application of the owner of developed property to the irrigation 7 diverted stream flows or rising ground waters 8 infiltration of uncontaminated groundwater as defined in 40 cfr  9 pumping of uncontaminated groundwater 10 discharges from potable water sources foundation drains irrigation water springs and water from crawl spaces or footing drains 11 air conditioning condensation 12 lawn watering 13 house washing and individual car washing on residential lots 14 dechlorinated swimming pool discharges with ph between 60 to 80 standard units at ambient water temperature and with less than 010 milligrams per liter or parts per million 15 water from street sidewalk or parking lot washing to remove algae or oil buildup 16 application of salts or other deicing substances to streets sidewalks and parking lots 17 discharges associated with dye testing provided that the program authority is notified in writing before the test c if any activity listed in subsection b above is found by the city manager or hisher designee to be a source of pollutants to the citys ms4 the city manager or hisher designee shall serve a written notice to the party responsible for the activity ordering that the activity be ceased or conducted in a manner employees to be employed by such department as shall be approved by the city council as provided hereafter such other person likewise may hold the office of fire department chief as the city council city administration 2 he or she shall make appropriate recommendations regarding desirable fire protection and fire prevention measures 3 he shall be responsible for all fire department property including fire station apparatus and equipment 4 he shall furnish all personnel with copies of the fire department rules and of any general written orders that may be issued regarding the operation of the department 5 he shall be responsible for the appointment and assignment of the personnel to their duties he shall see that these duties are properly performed 6 he shall assign the training officer the fire prevention officer and such other officers or employees as may be required 7 he shall see that order and discipline are maintained 8 he shall be responsible for preparing the annual budget and for the proper expenditure of funds as prescribed in the fiscal policy of the city 9 he shall maintain a personnel roster of all officers employees and volunteer firefighters providing operations assisted by such personnel as he shall designate when available he shall respond to all alarms for structural fires and to other serious fires within the municipality  promulgation of systems in premises to which the fire department is expected to respond in order to reduce the number of false alarms and to protect the health safety and welfare of the residents of the city  definitions for the purpose of this article the following definitions apply a alarm board the facility located in the communications section of the fire department which is designed to receive direct signals from authorized alarm systems b automatic dialing device a device which is interconnected to a telephone line and is programmed to select a predetermined telephone number and to transmit by prerecorded voice message or code signal the existence of criminal activity or a fire at the protected premises c bank a financial institution which is required by regulations issued pursuant to the bank protection act of 196 to maintain an alarm system or other appropriate device for promptly notifying a local police department that a robbery or burglary has occurred or is in progress d false alarm any communication generated by or as a result of a security or fire alarm system which communication results in an investigation by the fire department when the investigation reveals no evidence or indication of criminal activity or other actual hazard false alarms include negligently or accidentally activated signals  signals which are the result of faulty malfunctioning or improperly installed or maintained equipment  signals which are purposely activated to summon the fire department in nonemergency situations  and signals for which the actual cause is not determined false alarms shall not include signals activated by unusually severe weather conditions or by other causes which are identified and determined by fire department to be beyond the control of the user e hazard an event requiring urgent attention and to which the fire department is expected to respond f person any individual firm partnership association company corporation or organization of any kind g protected premises the premises upon which a security or fire alarm system is located h security or fire alarm system any assembly of equipment or a device designated to detect and signal the unauthorized intrusion into premises or to signal an attempted burglary robbery other criminal activity or to signal a fire at the protected premises to which the fire department is expected to respond such term however shall not include security alarm systems maintained by governmental agencies or departments i user any person using a security or fire alarm regardless of whether the person owns the security or fire system or the premises on which it is located  intentional false alarmsprohibited a it shall be unlawful for any person knowingly and without just cause to activate a security or fire alarm to summon the fire department in situations where there is no actual or threatened criminal or fire safety requiring immediate police or fire response b violation of this section shall constitute a class i misdemeanor punishable by a fine of one thousand dollars $100000 or not more than twelve 12 months in jail or both  false alarmdeactivation the police officer or fire and rescue official responding to a false alarm shall have the authority to deactivate an alarm system without liability when the alarm system is disturbing the peace and quiet of the community if the user fails to deactivate the alarm system within a reasonable time  systems not connected to alarm board a after the effective date of this article it shall be unlawful for any person to install operate or maintain an automatic dialing device which is programmed to transmit a prerecorded message or code signal directly from a residence or dwelling to a telephone number assigned to the fire department or to install operate or maintain an automatic dialing device or other security or fire alarm system in violation of the provisions of this section b users of automatic dialing devices which connect to the alarm board of the fire department shall notify the fire department of the possession of such systems within thirty 30 days of the enactment of this article c nonresidential users may connect or operate automatic dialing devices upon the following conditions 1 notification of installation on forms to be provided by the fire marshal containing the following information a name and address of protected premises b name address and telephone number of person installing maintaining andor owning the automatic dialing device c name address and telephone number of personnel to be contacted in case of alarm or malfunction d any additional relevant information required by the fire marshal 2 installation by a licensed alarm business or licensed electrician certified to do business in the commonwealth with the cost to be paid by the user 3 monthly inspections and testing of the system by the user and reporting of the monthly inspection results to the fire marshal 4 residential and nonresidential users may connect or operate security or fire alarm systems other than automatic dialing devices pursuant to the conditions set forth in subsections c1 c3 of this section  false alarm charges a no fee shall be charged for a false alarm if the fire department is notified of the false alarm by the users authorized agentemployee prior to the dispatch of vehicles or personnel to the scene of the alarm b after three 3 false alarms at a single protected premises within the same onemonth period users shall be charged a service charge of fifty dollars $5000 for the fourth false alarm which results in a police department response and shall be charged a service charge of one hundred dollars $10000 for each tactical unit which is dispatched for a fire and rescue response to the protected premises c after the occurrence of four 4 false alarms at a single protected premises within the same onemonth period the charge for responding to false alarms at the protected premises shall be increased by fifty dollars $5000 for each successive false alarm eg one hundred dollars $10000 one hundred fifty dollars $15000 for the fifth alarm two hundred dollars $20000 and two hundred fifty dollars $25000 for the sixth alarm etc d in the event a user fails to pay the assessed service charge within thirty 30 days of billing the user shall be charged interest at the judgment rate of interest from the date the charge was assessed e charges shall be paid to the city treasurer f the city treasurer may obtain authorization from the governing body for the city attorney to institute appropriate legal proceeding against any bank or other user to collect any delinquent service charge including interest which has been assessed  suspension of responses to alarms in the event of the occurrence of three 3 or more false alarms within a single onemonth protected premises in any single onemonth period or in the event the user fails to pay the assessed service charge for false alarms within thirty 30 days of billing the fire marshal may by giving the user five 5 days written notice advise the user that after a specified date the fire department shall not respond to alarms at the protected premises until all delinquent service charges including interest have been paid and the user demonstrates to the fire marshal or his designated agent that corrective action has been taken to prevent additional false alarms and that the system is functioning properly unless otherwise required by law a user who desires to suspend for a temporary period of time fire department responses to alarms due to malfunctions in the system or for any other reason may so advise the fire marshal in writing specifying the effective date of the suspension resumption of responses shall be effective after the user provides written notice to the fire marshal any charges assessed prior to the effective date of any suspension shall remain due and owing  appeal proceedings any user may appeal an action by the fire marshal to assess a service charge for a false alarm the appeal shall be made in writing to the city manager within ten 10 days after such action statewide fire prevention have the meanings shown herein bonfire means an outdoor fire utilized for ceremonial purposes land clearing refuse means brush stumps and other vegetation and similar matter bonfire and for land clearing refuse b applications for open burning shall be submitted in writing at least seventytwo 72 hours before the fire is set and shall be in such form and contain such information as required by the fire marshal such application shall contain as a minimum information regarding the purpose of the proposed burning the nature and quantities of material to be burned the date when such burning will take place the location of the burning site and the onsite fire extinguishing equipment to be provided c open burning shall be permitted with prior notification to the fire marshal and in compliance with the commonwealth of virginia state air pollution control board regulations provided that any conditions specified in the permission are followed for 1 disposal of hazardous or toxic materials where the fire marshal and the virginia department of environmental quality determine that there is no practical alternative method of disposal 2 instruction in the methods of fire fighting or for research in the control of fire in emergency or other extraordinary circumstances for any purpose determined to be necessary by the fire marshal and as authorized by the virginia department of environmental quality 3 disposal of debris or to remedy an emergency resulting from a disaster situation and when operating under an emergency declaration of the federal state or local government d burning of land clearing refuse other than agricultural shall be conducted utilizing special incineration devices as defined in the state air pollution control board regulations concerning emission standards for open burning a separate permit is required for each separate or new special incineration device on a site e the fire marshal shall prohibit open burning that will be offensive or objectionable due to smoke or odor emissions when atmospheric conditions or local circumstances make such fires hazardous the fire marshal shall order the extinguishment by the permit holder or the fire department of any open burning which creates or adds to a hazardous or objectionable situation burning of land clearing refuse is prohibited in the months of june july and august in accordance with virginia emissions standards for open burning  location the location for any open burning shall not be less than fifty 50 feet from any structure and provisions shall be made to preventing the fire from spreading to within fifty 50 feet of any structure fires in approved containers shall be permitted provided that such fires are not less than fifteen 15 feet from any structure the burning of land clearing refuse shall not be less than one thousand 1000 feet from an occupied structure  materials open burning shall not be utilized for waste disposal purposes shall maximum size and duration of a bonfire shall not be increased by the fire marshal unless it is determined that safety requirements of the situation and the desirable duration of the burn warrant the increase b fuel for a bonfire shall consist only of seasoned dry firewood and shall be ignited with a small quantity of paper the fire shall not be utilized for waste disposal purposes and the fuel shall be chosen to minimize the generation of air contaminants c all permits shall be requested by and issued to the owner of the land upon which the bonfire is to be kindled  recreational fires general purpose the purpose of this chapter is to regulate the operation of taxicabs for hire within the city the city in order to provide the citizens of the city with safe economical adequate and efficient taxicab service  2304 violations unless otherwise specifically provided any person convicted of violating any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars $10000 for the first offense and not more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each subsequent offense  2304 definitions a for the purposes of by this chapter  2304 general operating requirements every taxicab shall be operated in accordance with the laws of virginia and the provisions of this chapter and other ordinances of the city with due regard to the safety comfort and convenience of passengers and the general public  2304 information to be kept on file with taxicab inspector every certificate holder shall maintain on file with his certificate he shall within fortyeight 48 hours after he becomes aware of any change in the information required in this section report same to the taxicab inspector  2304 place of business or the taxicab business in the city and maintaining a place of business or office with telephone service within the geographic boundaries of prince william county the county or the city of manassas shall be deemed to be in compliance with this section provided such person complies with all provisions of this chapter  2304 twentyfourhour service required a it is not necessary for the operator of a taxicab business in the city to have his place of business or office open twentyfour 24 hours per day but the certificate holder or his employees must be on duty in the office and available by telephone to respond to requests for service twentyfour 24 hours per day b the taxicab inspector may when a request is made in writing to the taxicab inspector by a certificate holder allow the certificate holder to conduct dispatch operations receiving telephone calls for requests for service and dispatching taxicabs in response to such calls from another location other than the business office such written request shall be made at least five 5 working days prior to the requested date unless there are emergency circumstances and will be for a defined temporary time frame as established and approved by the taxicab inspector such temporary dispatching services shall be in accordance with all zoning regulations  2304 duty to respond to requests for service the operator of a taxicab business shall cause response to be made to all calls and requests for service within the boundaries of manassas park the operator shall have the option of responding to the call for service or of referring the caller to another taxicab operator whose place of business is at a shorter distance in the city from the caller  2304 use for unlawful purposes no owner or driver shall knowingly permit such vehicle to be used for unlawful purposes or to transport persons therein to places for such purposes  2304 transportation of animals while in service only an animal in the company of a paying passenger shall be allowed in a taxicab transportation of a passengers animal is at the discretion of the driver and only if the passenger agrees to keep the animal under control this section shall not apply to animals assisting bona fide handicapped persons  2304 maximum length of drivers working day no driver shall drive a taxicab nor shall any certificate holder or his employees require or permit drivers to drive a taxicab more than thirteen 13 hours in any consecutive twentyfourhour period  2304 driver to be clean and neat every driver of a taxicab shall while on duty be hygienically clean neat in appearance and suitably dressed the term suitably dressed shall mean the wearing of trousers slacks shoes and appropriate outer garments in warm weather the driver may wear as an outer garment a shirt with collar with or without a tie a blouse or a sweater in warm weather shorts are permitted if tailored in appearance cutoffs are not suitable drivers shall not wear underwear tank tops body shirts swimwear jogging suits or similar types of attire when worn as outer garments nor shall drivers wear any clothing with open tears rents or other holes  2304 use of tobacco and radio by driverpassenger no driver while his taxicab is occupied by a passenger shall smoke or play a radio other than the one used for communications with his dispatcher if his passenger requests that he not do so passengers may not smoke in a taxicab if a no smoking sign is posted in such taxicab  2304 use of drugs and alcohol by driver a at no time shall a driver use alcoholic beverages narcotics or other scheduled drugs while in service or while otherwise operating a taxicab b the transportation of alcoholic beverages other than alcoholic beverages carried in the possession of a paying passenger is prohibited in taxicabs while the driver is in service c at no time shall any driver independent or owner or any employee or agent of the same use any alcoholic beverages narcotics or other scheduled drugs within the business office while on duty  2304 restrictions on loading and unloading no driver shall stop to load or unload passengers or their belongings on the traveled portion of any street highway or other public way or any intersection or crosswalk thereof no driver shall stop to load or unload in any manner that would in any way impede or interfere with the orderly flow of traffic or pedestrians or endanger the safety of his passenger  2304 general limitation on number of passengers no driver shall permit more persons to be carried in a taxicab in the city at any one 1 time than the seating capacity of the taxicab as rated by the automobile manufacturer including the driver but excluding children in arms  2304 limitation on number of passengers on front seat at no time shall more than two 2 persons in addition to the driver ride on the front seat of any taxicab a child in arms shall not be permitted to ride in the front seat of any taxicab  2304 refusal of passengers a no driver shall refuse or neglect to convey any orderly person upon request unless previously engaged or forbidden by the provisions of this chapter to do so b a driver may refuse to convey an unaccompanied child less than five 5 years old c a driver owner independent or certificate holder may refuse to convey any person who has threatened assaulted robbed or failed to pay the legal fare for any previous trip or service provided to such person by i such driver or ii the owner independent or certificate holder for whom such driver works  2304 deception of passengers no driver shall deceive or attempt to deceive any passenger who may ride in his taxicab or who may desire to ride in such taxicab as to his destination or the rate or fare to be charged or convey any passenger or cause him to be conveyed to a place other than directed by the passenger in no event shall any driver take a longer route than necessary unless so requested by the passenger  2304 compliance with request of passenger as to speed and route every driver shall comply with all reasonable and lawful requests of his passengers as to the speed of travel and the route to be taken  2304 accident reports every accident involving a taxicab governed by the provisions of this chapter shall be immediately reported to the police department by the driver involved in addition the taxicab inspector shall be notified in writing of such accident within five 5 business days of its occurrence by the driver involved  2304 drivers manifests a every driver shall maintain a daily manifest which shall be approved by the taxicab inspector upon which shall be clearly and legibly recorded the following 1 the date and time the driver went in service and went out of service and the number of hours on duty 2 the taxicab number the drivers name and his permit number 3 the odometer reading of the taxicab at the beginning and end of each working day 4 all trips made each day showing the time and place of origin and destination the number of passengers the fare and any extra charges this information shall be recorded at the beginning and end of each trip b no manifest required by this section shall be transferred from one 1 taxicab to another if the driver changes taxicabs during a working day a separate manifest shall be maintained for each such taxicab c it shall be unlawful for any driver to maintain an incomplete manifest d all completed manifests shall be returned to the operator by the driver as soon as is practicable after the end of the drivers working day and in no event less frequently than once a week e all operators shall retain and preserve all manifests for a period of no less than three 3 months manifests shall be stored and preserved at the operators place of business or office and shall be subject to inspection by the taxicab inspector or other police department personnel at all reasonable times moreover operators shall provide specified manifests no later than eight 8 hours after such manifests have been requested by the taxicab inspector or other police department personnel the taxicab inspector or any sworn police officer shall have the authority to remove any of the manifests from the operators office for inspection purposes the manifests shall be returned within two 2 weeks after such removal and the operator shall be given a receipt stating exactly which of such manifests have been removed f the certificate holder shall maintain an electronic database of all requests for service dispatched for a period of at least six 6 months this electronic database should be capable of crossreferencing the drivers name taxicab number and time and date of a specified pick up request this information shall be subject to inspection by the taxicab inspector or other police department personnel at all reasonable times  2304 disposition of articles left in vehicle any article found in a taxicab shall be returned with reasonable promptness to its owner if he is known or such owner shall be promptly notified of the whereabouts of the article so that he may claim it if the owner is not known the driver shall note the article on the manifest referred to in section 1124 and notify the certificate holder of the found article the article shall be turned over to the certificate holder at the end of the drivers tour of duty the operator shall maintain the lost article in a safe place for at least seven 7 days if the article is not claimed by its owner within seven 7 days the article shall be turned over to the taxicab inspector the taxicab inspector shall hold the article until claimed by its owner if no claim is received within ninety 90 days the article shall be disposed of according to law  2304 severability in the event any part or provision of this chapter or the application thereof to any person or circumstance is held to be illegal or invalid such holdings shall not have the effect of making illegal or invalid any of the other parts or provisions thereof or the application of such provision to other persons or circumstances it shall be presumed that this chapter would have been adopted without such illegal or invalid part or provision or application if the determination of invalidity had been known at the time of adoption  2304 secs 11271135  reserved article ii  taxicab performance of such other duties and responsibilities as may be imposed upon it consider and act upon applications for certificates and appeals from actions of the taxicab inspectors office in the manner more specifically set forth in other sections of this chapter  2304 quorum  required vote for action five 5 members of the regional review board shall constitute a quorum when a quorum is established actions of the regional review board shall be effective only upon a majority vote of the members thereof present  provided however that modification or reversal of an action of the taxicab inspector on appeal shall be effective only upon a concurring vote of at least four 4 members of the regional review board  2304 hearings and decisions generally all hearings of the regional review board shall be open to the public and shall be insofar as is reasonably practicable informal and free of technical rules of law or evidence applicants and appellants shall be entitled to be heard in person and by counsel and shall be entitled to provide for the recording of the proceedings in any manner which will not impede the orderly conduct of the hearing decisions of the regional review board shall be reduced to writing and a copy thereof shall be furnished to the taxicab inspector and to any applicant or appellant affected thereby the regional review board may establish such rules of procedure for the conduct of its hearings as may be consistent with the provisions and intent of this chapter  2304 appeals to regional review board a if the taxicab inspector denies suspends or revokes or denies renewal of any previously issued permit or revokes or suspends any certificate any person affected thereby may appeal such decision to the regional review board upon making such appeal any driver must submit a copy of its department of motor vehicles traffic record for consideration by the regional review board such appeal shall be filed by the appellant or his attorney with the secretary of the regional review board or the secretarys designee the appellant or his attorney shall file a written notice of appeal signed by the appellant or his attorney requesting a hearing and setting forth a brief statement of the reasons thereof such appeal shall be filed within ten 10 days of receipt of the notice of denial suspension or revocation b upon receipt of a notice of appeal the regional review board shall set a time and place for a hearing and shall give the appellant or his attorney and the taxicab inspector reasonable notice thereof all hearings on appeals shall be scheduled and determined as promptly as practicable and in no event more than thirty 30 days from the date the notice of appeal is filed c upon the hearing of an appeal under this section the regional review board shall consider the case record as well as any statement offered by any interested party and shall determine the matter de novo and shall upon the basis of the record and evidence presented before it affirm modify or reverse the decision of the taxicab inspector d if the regional review board affirms the decision of the taxicab inspector to deny suspend or revoke a permit or to suspend or revoke a certificate the suspension or revocation shall be effective from the date of the boards order or at such time as directed by majority vote of the regional review board except as otherwise provided in this chapter if the regional review board reverses the decision of the taxicab inspector it shall direct the taxicab inspector to issue or restore the permit or certificate in accordance with its order e the appeal of the decision of the taxicab inspector to suspend or revoke a permit or to suspend or revoke or deny renewal of a certificate shall stay the effective date of the suspension revocation or denial  provided however any suspension or revocation of any such certificate for the reasons listed in subsection 1169a4 shall take effect as provided in such section and shall remain in full force and effect until the regional review board has rendered its decision on the appeal  2304 secs 11421155  reserved article iii  operators certificate required  exceptions no board shall consider the following 1 the adequacy of existing public vehicle service and other forms of passenger transportation 2 the kind class and character of vehicles to be used and the adequacy
