traffic and criminal convictions every driver shall notify the taxicab inspector in writing of any traffic or criminal convictions or suspensions or revocations within ten 10 days of such convictions any driver who has been arrested or charged with a felony offense shall notify the taxicab inspector within ten 10 days of arrest  2304 secs 119611105  reserved article v  general vehicle requirements vehicle type every taxicab operated in the city shall be built for use as a taxicab or shall be of an approved type by the taxicab inspector  2304 general construction and maintenance requirements a every taxicab shall be so constructed and maintained as to provide for the safety of the public and for continuous and satisfactory operation and to reduce noise and vibration caused by operation every taxicab shall be structurally sound as to all of its parts and shall not have broken or cracked fenders or glass or be in need of body repair b every taxicab shall be kept in such clean and sanitary condition as is reasonably possible considering existing weather conditions  2304 doors every taxicab shall be equipped with at least two 2 doors for the entrance and exit of passengers in addition to the doors which give access to the drivers seat all passenger doors shall be so constructed that they will remain securely fastened during normal operation but may be easily opened by a passenger in an emergency  2304 tires every taxicab shall be equipped with tires having at least two thirtyseconds  232  of an inch of tread and no taxicab shall be operated with unsafe tires every taxicab shall be equipped with a properly inflated spare tire with the same tread as required above mounted on an appropriate rim snow tires or tire chains shall be used when emergency snow plans are put into effect  2304 speedometer every taxicab shall be equipped with a standard speedometer properly installed maintained in good working order and exposed to view no taxicab shall be operated in a taxicab service while such speedometer is out of repair or disconnected  2304 heater air conditioner every taxicab shall be equipped with a heater sufficient to heat the interior of the taxicab adequately in cold weather every taxicab shall be equipped with an air conditioner sufficient to cool the interior of the taxicab adequately in hot weather heat or air conditioning shall be used or adjusted at the request of the passenger  2304 cruising lights every taxicab shall have cruising lights mounted on the top of the taxicab in the forward portion thereof such lights shall be of such design as to identify the vehicle as a taxicab driver when holding forth their cab for hire shall have the cruising lights on from sundown to sunup  2304 interior light every taxicab shall be equipped with a light capable of illuminating the interior of the taxicab and controlled by the operation of the doors or manually controlled by the driver such light shall be in use while passengers are entering or leaving the taxicab during hours of darkness  2304 shades or curtains no taxicab shall be equipped with shades or curtains which can be manipulated in such a way as to shield the occupants or driver from observation from without the vehicle  2304 paint every taxicab shall be painted in accordance with the operators certificate color scheme and in such manner as to give a good appearance and reasonable protection from all elements to all exposed surfaces  2304 identifying markings all identifying markings on taxicabs shall be plainly distinguishable in letters at least three 3 inches high permanently painted or otherwise permanently affixed to each of the two 2 sides of the taxicab and to the rear of the taxicab the lettering shall show the vehicle number assigned to it by its owner or operator and the name of the company individual or association by whom the taxicab is owned or operated  2304 inspection and approval or condemnation a prior to the use and operation of any taxicab under the provisions of this chapter the taxicab shall be inspected by the taxicab inspector and found to comply with the provisions of this chapter and the current motor vehicle laws of the state every taxicab operating under this chapter shall be inspected semiannually every six 6 months by a licensed state inspection station and proof of such inspection shall be furnished to the taxicab inspector within ten 10 days of completion of inspection and at any other reasonable time requested by the taxicab inspector such inspections shall be at the time and place designated by the taxicab inspector b if the taxicab is found by the taxicab inspector not to be in compliance with the provisions of this chapter it shall be condemned and a red tag stating condemned shall be affixed on the taximeter in clear view of the public it shall be unlawful for any person to remove such tag or operate such taxicab for hire until the deficiencies have been corrected and the taxicab has been reinspected and approved by the taxicab inspector c if a vehicle cannot be made available for the designated inspection time either the certificate holder or the driver shall be required to notify the taxicab inspectors office failure to notify may result in an imposed suspension to the driver andor vehicle until such vehicle is inspected and approved by the taxicab inspector  2304 secs 1111811130  reserved article vi  taximeters required  exception it shall be unlawful for any person to operate a taxicab or to cause a taxicab to be operated for hire or to accept any passenger for hire or to carry any paying passenger within the city unless such vehicle is equipped with a taximeter which shall be in proper operation at all times while any person other than the operator is riding therein this section shall not apply to taxicabs which are not on duty and in operation for hire and on which is posted a visible sign clearly marked offduty such sign shall be displayed on the righthand sun visor so it can be seen by the public  2304 type to be used taximeters required by this article shall be of a type approved in writing by the taxicab inspector  2304 specifications a taximeters required by this article shall be capable of computing fares on the basis of mileage and time b every taximeter shall be equipped with a fare recording device plainly visible to the passenger and with a signal device which shall be exhibited at all times while the taxicab is in operation  2304 testing and approval it shall be unlawful for any person to use any taximeter until the same has been inspected and found to be accurate by a service technician and approved by him  2304 sealing a when a taximeter is inspected and approved by a service technician it shall be sealed by the taxicab inspector every taximeter shall be capable of being completely sealed b it shall be unlawful for any person to operate a taxicab unless the taximeter therein is sealed in accordance with this section  2304 cover and gear to be intact it shall be unlawful for any person to operate any taxicab if the taximeter therein does not have its cover and gear intact  2304 altering or tampering with meter or vehicle parts to which meter attached a it shall be unlawful for any person to make any changes or alterations in any taximeter without the approval of the taxicab inspector b it shall be unlawful for any person to tamper with any taximeter required by this article or to in any manner change or cause to be changed any part of any taximeter or any part of any vehicle to which such taximeter is attached directly or indirectly which may alter the accuracy of such meter c it shall be unlawful for any person to make any change in the mechanical condition of the wheels tires or gears of any taxicab with intent to cause false registration by the taximeter of the fare to be charged any passenger  2304 removal from vehicle to which assigned  transfer to another vehicle no taximeter shall be removed from the taxicab to which it is assigned and reinstalled or transferred to another taxicab without inspection by a service technician or the taxicab inspector  2304 repair of meter by approved repairman a notwithstanding the provisions contained elsewhere in this article it shall be lawful for a service technician approved pursuant to the provisions of subsection b of this section to perform repairs on a taximeter without prior notification having been given to the taxicab inspector provided that notification of such repairs is given to the taxicab inspector in accordance with the policy in effect at the time of the repairs a taximeter so repaired may be used without further inspection by the taxicab inspector provided that the service technician tests the vehicle on an approved course if the taximeter seal is broken during any such repairs b the taxicab inspector shall maintain a list of all persons authorized to perform repairs on taximeters as set out in subsection a above which list shall be available for inspection and copying in the office of the taxicab inspector during all normal business hours the taxicab inspector shall place on the list all persons and businesses having demonstrated a capability to perform repairs on taximeters who have made application to be included on the list in accordance with regulations to be promulgated by the taxicab inspector  2304 secs 1114011150  reserved article vii  fares and charges rates generally a the rates for the transportation of passengers in the city by taxicabs shall be as follows 1 for the initial hiring or activation of the meter for service and to include the first onetenth  110  of a mile or fraction thereof the sum of three dollars $300 for each additional onetenth  110  of a mile or fraction thereof the sum of fifteen cents $015 2 for each passenger carried in excess of one 1 except for an infant in arms up to and including two 2 years of age the sum of one dollar $100 regardless of distance traveled 3 for each twentyseven 27 seconds waiting time the sum of fifteen cents $015 b for the purposes of subsection a3 above waiting time shall be deemed to include 1 time consumed while the taxicab is waiting and unavailable to other passengers for hire beginning five 5 minutes after the later of i time of arrival at the place to which it has been called or ii the agreed pickup time 2 time consumed while the taxicab is stopped or slowed for traffic to a speed less than fifteen 15 miles per hour while such time is charged there shall be no charges for mileage under subsection a13 of this section 3 time consumed for delays or stopovers en route at the direction of the passenger or customer waiting time shall not include time lost on account of inefficiency of the taxicab police traffic stop vehicle accident involving the taxicab or any delay caused by the driver c when a driver has taken into a taxicab a passenger for transportation and has actually begun the transportation of such passenger no other person shall be received by the driver into such taxicab until the original passengers destination is reached except with the consent of such original passenger no charge shall be made for the additional passenger except when the additional passenger rides beyond the original passengers destination where the meter shall be reset to compute the additional passengers fare to his destination this subsection shall not apply to the exceptions listed in section 11159 d in cases where more than one 1 passenger enters a taxicab at the same time and bound for different destinations the fare shall be charged as follows whenever a passenger gets out and pays the fare then the meter shall be reset upon such passengers departure  however when such passenger does not pay the fare then the total fare shall be paid by the last passenger delivered this subsection shall not apply to the exceptions listed in section 11159 e drivers may give discounted fares of up to twentyfive 25 per cent to passengers carrying a drivers license or other written proof that they are at least sixtyfive 65 years old  2304 service charge for pickups beyond threemile radius of operation in addition to the rates prescribed by section 11151 a service charge of one dollar $100 per mile may be charged from the operators base of operation or closest taxicab stand to the point of pickup when a request for service is from beyond the operators threemile radius of operation  provided that this charge shall not be allowed unless the prospective passenger is advised of the service charge at the time the service is requested or if the passengers destination is within three 3 miles of the operators base of operation or closest taxicab stand  2304 charge for transporting baggage groceries etc a in addition to the rates prescribed in section 11151 the operator of a taxicab may impose and collect the following charges 1 a transportation charge not to exceed twentyfive cents $025 for baggage or suitcases handled by the driver in excess of two 2 per passenger 2 a transportation charge for trunks large boxes or similar containers of three 3 cubic feet or more of one dollar $100 3 a transportation charge not to exceed ten cents $010 for bags of groceries or other shopping bags handled by the driver in excess of two 2 per passenger 4 a transportation charge of fifty cents $050 for large boxes bags or similar containers less than three 3 cubic feet 5 a cleanup charge of twentyfive dollars $2500 if a passenger vomits or expectorates or otherwise causes an odor wets or stains the interior on the upholstery or other surface of a taxicab or leaves any article in the taxicab that may cause a health risk so that it requires more than a reasonable effort to clean or remove before a driver can go back into service 6 a reimbursement charge equal to any road tolls parking fees or other toll or fee incurred by a driver to provide the requested service to a passenger b none of the charges authorized by this section shall be allowed unless a list of such charges is available to the passenger at hisher request and the driver informs the passenger of such charges  2304 charge for transporting animals in addition to the rates prescribed by section 11151 the operator of a taxicab may charge one dollar $100 for the transportation of any animal other than one held by the passenger or assisting a bona fide handicapped person if any animal should litter a taxicab an additional charge may be made of twentyfive dollars $2500  2304 charge for personal services a in addition to the rates prescribed by sections 11151 and 11153 a personalservice charge not to exceed two dollars $200 may be charged by the operator of a taxicab when a personal service is performed a personal service is defined as any service at the request of the passenger or customer which requires the driver to leave the vicinity of the taxicab each request by the passenger or customer shall constitute a separate personal service for which a separate charge may be made b no charge authorized by this section shall be allowed unless the passenger or customer is advised of the charge when he requests the service and before it is performed  2304 procedure for changing fares or rates any petition for increase or decrease of fares or rates prescribed by this article shall be presented in writing to the governing body the board shall after public notice and after a public hearing make a determination whether the rate changes are just and reasonable if found to be just and reasonable such changes shall become effective sixty 60 days thereafter or at such other time as the board may ordain this procedure shall constitute an automatic revision of the fares or rates prescribed in this article and each subsequent vote of the governing body to increase or decrease such fares or rates shall constitute an amendment to this article and shall be recorded as such by the clerk to the governing body  2304 posting of rates the rates prescribed by this article shall be posted in such a manner as to be easily visible to all passengers in a taxicab and passengers entering a taxicab rate posters shall be supplied by the taxicab inspector to all operators who shall be charged the actual cost for production of the same  2304 unlawful charges a it shall be unlawful for the certificate holder or driver of any taxicab to charge or knowingly allow to be charged any fare for the transportation of passengers except as provided in this article b in no event may a person be charged for loading or unloading a wheelchair into or from a taxicab  2304   taxicab services and fares for elderly or physically handicapped persons pursuant to a contract between a taxicab certificate holder and the city or a nonprofit private or public organization a the rates and fares provided for under this article shall not apply when any taxicab is operated pursuant to a contract entered into under paragraph b of this section b upon approval of the regional review board any certificate holder may enter into a contract on an annual or semiannual basis with the city or any nonprofit private or public organization to provide taxicab services for elderly physically handicapped or low income persons who are certified as eligible in accordance with standards set forth in the contract under a fare schedule agreed upon in the contract such fare schedule may differ from the fares established in other sections of this article c any certificate holder operating a taxicab pursuant to such a contract shall comply with all other provisions of this chapter except where otherwise specified  2304 nonpaying passengers a no nonpaying passenger shall be transported with a paying passenger except bona fide officers or employees of the certificate holder a police officer engaged in the performance of his duty and unable to obtain other adequate means of transportation a taxicab inspector or medicaid patients and authorized attendants designated by the department of health to be transported under a providers agreement b this section shall not apply when any taxicab is operated pursuant to a contract provided for in section 111581  2304 payment in advance any driver may at his discretion demand payment in advance of the rendering of any service of the estimated charges for such service adjustments shall be made at the passengers destination in accordance with the rates and charges established by this article  2304 refusal to pay  hiring taxicab with intent to defraud a it shall be unlawful for any taxicab passenger to refuse to pay the legal fare for transporting such passenger andor any allowable charges under article vii it shall be unlawful for any person to hire any taxicab with the intent to defraud the operator owner or driver of the value of such service b any person violating this section shall be guilty of a class 3 misdemeanor for each offense  2304 receipt for payment the driver of any taxicab shall upon the request of a passenger give a receipt to the passenger for the fare charged this receipt shall contain the name of the taxicab company the taxicab number the drivers name and permit number the date and time of the trip the origin and destination and the amount of the fare  2304 gambling definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section gambling device a gambling device includes 1 any device machine paraphernalia equipment or other thing including books records and other papers which are actually used in an illegal gambling operation or activity and 2 any machine apparatus implement instrument contrivance board or other thing including but not limited to those dependent upon the insertion of a coin or other object for their operation which operates either completely automatically or with the aid of some physical act by the player or operator in such a manner that depending upon elements of chance it may eject something of value or determine the prize or other thing of value to which the player is entitled  provided however that the return to the user of nothing more than additional chances or the right to use such machine is not deemed something of value  and provided further that machines that only sell or entitle the user to items of merchandise of equivalent value that may differ from each other in composition size shape or color shall not be deemed gambling devices such devices are no less gambling devices if they indicate beforehand the definite result of one or more operations but not all the operations nor are they any less gambling devices because apart from their use or adaptability as such they may also sell or deliver something of value on a basis other than chance illegal gambling the making placing or receipt of any bet or wager in this city of money or other where the context clearly indicates a different meaning designated enforcement officer the director of community development or his designee any city law enforcement officer or any duly designated sworn special police officer hazardous waste any hazardous material as defined in section 1311 which because of its quantity concentration or physical chemical or infectious characteristics may 1 cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality or an increase in serious irreversible or incapacitating illness  or 2 pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment when improperly treated stored transported disposed of or otherwise managed public health or safety menace any condition which might endanger the health or safety of the public including but not limited to 1 unsanitary or improper storage or disposal of trash garbage refuse debris other solid waste or hazardous waste  2 unburied dead animals  3 accumulation of water causing mosquito or other vector breeding or proliferation  4 rodent or insect infestation  5 accumulation of bees fowl or animals in such a manner as to create a condition that may be injurious to the public health or safety  6 the accumulation of solid waste or hazardous waste in such a manner as to create a condition that may be injurious to the public health or safety  7 hazards such as open excavations open wells pits or parts thereof in danger of falling discarded refrigerators and freezers with doors attached unsecured vacant structures and or habitation for bats wasps or other venomous pests  8 garbage that is not contained in a watertight rodent proof container that is equipped with a tightfitting lid  9 improper disposal of medical dental veterinary or pharmaceutical equipment or supplies including but not limited to syringes needles scalpels blades and other medicinal items in solid or liquid form in such a manner as to make it possible for any other person to retrieve and utilize said equipment or supplies  10 any other condition that may be injurious to the public health or safety solid waste any refuse bulky waste organic waste as those terms are defined in section 1311 garbage sludge or other discarded material including solid liquid semisolid or contained gaseous material resulting from industrial commercial mining or agricultural operations or from community activities the term solid waste does not include 1 solid or dissolved material in domestic sewage  2 solid or dissolved material in irrigation return flows or in industrial discharges which are sources subject to a permit from the state water control board  or 3 source special nuclear or byproduct material as defined by the federal atomic energy act of 195 as amended  62116 health or safety menaces prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to create or maintain with the city any public health or safety menace  62116 inspection and notice a the designated enforcement officer is authorized to inspect occupied or vacant land or premises to ascertain the existence of health or safety menaces on such land or premises the designated enforcement officer shall inspect the land or premises at reasonable daylight times in a reasonable manner if the owner lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises denies the designated enforcement officer free access for such purposes the designated enforcement officer may inspect after obtaining a search warrant from a virginia court of competent jurisdiction b when any condition that constitutes a public health or safety menace is found on occupied or vacant land or premises the designated enforcement officer shall notify in writing the owner lessee occupant or person in control of such land or premises such written notice shall contain a description of the public health or safety menace  the time within which the menace shall be abated corrected or eliminated  a statement that the owner lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises may request a hearing within ten 10 days of the receipt of the notice  and an address or telephone number at which information may be obtained concerning such public health or safety menace the amount of time allowed to abate correct or eliminate the condition shall be fortyeight 48 hours upon a goodfaith showing that a longer period of time is required to abate correct or eliminate the condition the designated enforcement officer may allow a longer period of time not to exceed ten 10 days notice sent by registered or certified mail to the last known address of the owner as shown on the current real estate tax assessment books shall be deemed compliance with the notice requirement to the owner c when the written notice as provided for in this section is undeliverable or if an emergency is found to exist the designated enforcement officer shall cause a notice as described in subsection b above to be posted on the land or premises on which the public health or safety menace exists  62116 health or safety menaces abatement correction or elimination a following receipt of the written notice required by section 13317 the owner lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises on which a public health or safety menace exists shall promptly abate correct or eliminate the public health or safety menace as required by the notice failure to abate correct or eliminate the public health or safety menace within the time required shall constitute a class 3 misdemeanor b if the written notice is undeliverable and is therefore posted or if after the receipt of the written notice the owner lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises on which the condition exists fails to abate correct or eliminate the condition as required the designated enforcement officer after granting such owner lessee occupant or person in control an opportunity to be heard may take reasonable steps to abate correct or eliminate the condition whether the land or premises are occupied or vacant if the owner lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises denies free access for such purposes the designated enforcement officer may proceed after obtaining a search warrant from a virginia court of competent jurisdiction c costs and expenses incurred by the city for abating correcting or eliminated the public health or safety menace that remain unpaid shall be treated as follows 1 if against the owner of the land or premises such costs and expenses shall constitute a lien against such property ranking on a parity with liens for unpaid local taxes and shall be enforceable in accordance with va 13940 et seq and va 13965 et seq of title 581 of the virginia the city may waive such liens in order to facilitate the sale of the property such liens may be waived only as to a purchaser who is unrelated by blood or marriage to the owner and who has no business association with the owner all such liens shall remain a personal obligation of the owner of the property at the time the liens were imposed 2 if against the lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises such costs and expenses shall constitute a personal obligation of such lessee occupant or person in control of the land or premises  62116 emergency procedure in the case of an emergency the designated enforcement officer may take reasonable steps to abate correct or eliminate to the extent immediately necessary a public health and safety menace without providing the owner lessee occupant set a time and place for the hearing which shall occur within ten 10 days of the request for the hearing and shall so notify the designated enforcement officer and the appellant after the hearing the city manager or the designee of the city manager may order the appellant to abate correct or eliminate the health or safety menace in the same manner as the designated enforcement officer may require article iii  clean air footnotes  1  editors note adopted oct 16 199 amended the adding provisions designated as ch 133 art i  13311336 in order to maintain the structural integrity of the well as to provide space for future expansion of said ch 133 said provisions have been redesignated as ch 133 art ii  1332113326 at the discretion of the editor subsequently  adopted  renumbered art ii to art iii title this article shall be known and may be cited as the clean air the city of manassas park  purpose and intent based on a substantial body of scientific evidence and based on the 1986 report of the surgeon general entitled the health consequences of involuntary smoking the city hereby acknowledges that passively inhaled tobacco smoke poses a potential health hazard the purpose of this article is to protect the public health safety and welfare by regulating smoking in certain city facilities and in other public places in the city  definitions as used in this article unless the context requires a different meaning city means the city of manassas park person means any individual firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind private workplace means any office or work area which is not open to the public in the normal course of business except by individual invitation smoke or smoking means the carrying of any lighted pipe cigar or cigarette of any kind or any other lighted smoking equipment or the lighting inhaling or exhaling of smoke from a pipe cigar or cigarette of any kind  smoking in governmental facilities a all government buildings owned leased andor occupied by the city city building are hereby designated nonsmoking facilities these facilities include but are not necessarily limited to 1 city hall  2 school board  3 public works  4 social services  5 public safety  and 6 parks and recreation b the city shall provide reasonable no smoking areas considering the nature of the use and the size of the building in all city buildings the provisions of this section shall not apply to 1 public and private assembly rooms when these places are being used for private functions  and 2 office or work areas which are not entered by the general public in the normal course of business or use of the premises c the city manager shall be responsible for designation of rooms or areas in which smoking is permitted with all city buildings as follows 1 designated smoking areas shall not encompass so much of the building structure space place or areas open to the general public that reasonable no smoking areas considering the nature of the use and size of the building are not provided  2 designated smoking areas shall be separate to the extent reasonably practicable from those rooms or areas entered by the public in the normal use of the particular business or institution  and 3 in designated smoking areas ventilation systems and existing physical barriers shall be used when reasonably practicable to minimize the permeation of smoke into no smoking areas however this section shall not be construed as requiring modifications or alterations to any structure d in all city buildings the city manager or his designee shall post in a clear conspicuous and appropriate manner a sufficient number of signs including smoking permitted no smoking or no smoking   regulation of smoking in private places of employment employers may regulate smoking in the private workplace as they deem appropriate under the following conditions 1 if the designation of smoking and no smoking areas is the subject of a written agreement between the employer and his employees the provisions of the written agreement shall control such designation  and 2 a total ban on smoking in any workplace shall only be enforced by the employer upon an affirmative vote of a majority of the affected employees voting unless such ban is the subject of a contract of employment between the employer and the employees as a prior condition of employment this section shall not affect no smoking policies established by employers prior to the adoption of this section  smoking prohibited in certain public places a it is unlawful for any person to smoke in any of the following places 1 elevators regardless of capacity  2 common areas in an educational facility including but not limited to classrooms libraries hallways auditoriums and public meeting rooms  3 any part of a restaurant designated a no smoking area pursuant to the provisions of of the virginia indoor clean air act  4 indoor service lines and cashier areas  5 school buses and public conveyances  6 election polling rooms  7 hospital emergency rooms  and 8 designated no smoking areas b any restaurant having a seating capacity of fifty or more persons shall have a designated no smoking area sufficient to meet customer demand in determining the extent of the no smoking area the following shall not be included as seating capacity 1 seats in any bar or lounge area of a restaurant  and 2 seats in any separate room or section of a restaurant which is used exclusively for private functions c the proprietor or other person in charge of an educational facility health care facility or a retail establishment of fifteen thousand 15000 square feet or more serving the general public including but not limited to department stores grocery stores drug stores clothing stores and shoe stores shall designate reasonable no smoking areas considering the nature of the use and the size of the building d the proprietor or other person in charge of a space subject to the provisions of this article shall post signs stating smoking permitted or no smoking and in restaurants signs conspicuous to ordinary public view at or near each public entrance stating no smoking  any person failing to post such signs may be subject to a civil penalty of not more than twentyfive dollars $2500 e no person shall smoke in a designated no smoking area and any person who continues to smoke in such area after being asked to refrain from smoking may be subject to a civil penalty of not more than twentyfive dollars $2500 f this section shall not be construed to permit smoking where it is otherwise prohibited or restricted by other applicable provisions of law  licenses footnotes  1  editors note adopted dec 17 199 amended ch 14 to read as herein financial services means the buying selling handling managing investing and providing of advice regarding money credit securities or other investments gross receipts gross receipts means the whole entire total receipts without deduction for the base year from any business trade profession occupation or calling including cash credits offsets fees commissions brokerage charges and rentals and property of any kind nature or description from either sales made or services rendered gross receipts shall include in the case of merchants the value of supplies and goods furnished to or used by the licensee or his family or other persons for which less than full value has been paid the term gross receipts when used in connection with or in respect to financial transactions involving the sale of notes stocks bonds or other securities or the loan collection or advance of money or the discounting of notes bills or other evidence of debt shall mean gross interest gross discount gross commissions and the other gross receipts earned by means of or resulting from such financial transactions but gross receipts shall not include any principal amounts received in payment of debts gross receipts shall not include any amount not derived from the exercise of the licensed privilege to engage in a business or profession in the ordinary course of business in addition the following items shall be excluded from gross receipts 1 amounts received and paid to the united states the commonwealth or any county city or town for the virginia retail sales or use tax for any local sales tax or any local excise tax on cigarettes for any federal or state excise taxes on motor fuels  2 any amount representing the liquidation of a debt or conversion of another asset to the extent that the amount is attributable to a transaction previously taxed eg the factoring of accounts receivable created by sales which have been included in taxable receipts even though the creation of such debt and factoring are a regular part of its business  3 any amount representing returns and allowances granted by the business to its customer  4 receipts which are the proceeds of a loan transaction in which the licensee is the obligor  5 receipts representing the return of principal of a loan transaction in which the licensee is the creditor or the return of principal or basis upon the sale of a capital asset  6 rebates and discounts taken or received on account of purchases by the licensee a rebate or other incentive offered to induce the recipient to purchase certain goods or services from a person other than the offeror and which the recipient assigns to the licensee in consideration of the sale goods and services shall not be considered a rebate or discount to the licensee but shall be included in the licensees gross receipts together with any handling or other fees related to the incentive  7 withdrawals from inventory for purposes other than sale or distribution and for which no consideration is received and the occasional sale or exchange of assets other than inventory whether or not a gain or loss is recognized for federal income tax purposes  8 investment income not directly related to the privilege exercised by a business subject to licensure not classified as rendering financial services this exclusion shall apply to interest on bank accounts of the business and to interest dividends and other income derived from the investment of its own funds in securities and other types of investments unrelated to the licensed privilege this exclusion shall not apply to interest late fees and similar income attributable to an installment sale or other transaction that occurred in the regular course of business  9 the license and admission taxes established under city shall be construed to mean within the corporate limits of the city      4417 purposes of chapter a the purpose of this chapter is to adopt and levy within the limitations imposed by the virginia a system of license taxes applicable to each person engaged in a business trade profession occupation or calling in the city within the limitations imposed by this chapter and the virginia this chapter shall be construed broadly so as to impose a license tax on every person engaged in a business trade profession occupation or calling in the city b the license taxes enumerated in this chapter shall be for the privilege of engaging in a business trade profession occupation or calling in the city including all phases and activities including storing and warehousing of the business trade profession occupation or calling so conducted in the city or the maintenance of any office or branch office in the city either or both and for the granting of certain privileges any person engaged in a business trade profession occupation or calling at a definite place of business in the city shall be presumed for purposes of this chapter to conduct his operations entirely within the city unless such person demonstrates otherwise to the commissioner of revenue  application and adoption of state law as to all questions in regard to the duty and conduct of officers of the city in collecting and enforcing the license taxes imposed by this chapter and in regard to matters of construction and for definitions of terms used in this chapter and the rules and regulations applicable to putting the same in operation  for the assessment levy and collection of taxes for the current year and ensuing years reference is hereby made to the laws of the commonwealth and more particularly to title 581 et seq of the virginia as from time to time amended and any recodification or successor statutes or to so much thereof as is applicable to this chapter and is not inconsistent with it or the provisions of this other ordinances of the city for the conduct and guidance of the officers of the city and other parties affected by this chapter and for fixing their powers rights duties and obligations the provisions of such laws so far as applicable are hereby adopted without however being specially quoted or set forth in this chapter  license requirement every person shall apply for a license for each business or profession when engaging in a business in the city if a the person has a definite place of business in the city  b there is no definite place of business anywhere and the person resides in the city  or c there is no definite place of business in the city but the person operates amusement machines or is classified as an itinerant merchant peddler carnival circus contractor subject to of the virginia or public service corporation  exemption for home occupations with de minimis gross receipts in the event any resident of the city shall engage in any such business trade profession occupation or calling in the city which business trade profession occupation or calling is conducted as a home occupation as defined in city which does not produce gross income in excess of seven thousand five hundred dollars $750000 per year then such person shall be exempt from the requirement of city to file an application for and to obtain a current license provided however that such person shall file an application and pay the applicable license tax within thirty 30 days after the business trade profession occupation or calling shall produce gross revenue of seven thousand five hundred dollars $750000 or more  manufacturers license tax exemptions  determinations  appeals a exemption any business located within the city shall be exempt from the license tax but not from the requirement to file a license tax application for the privilege of manufacturing and selling goods wares and merchandise at wholesale at the place of manufacturing 1 determination the commissioner of the revenue shall determine based upon the following definitions whether any such business shall be entitled to the exemption set forth in this section 2 application any applicant claiming the manufacturing exemption from the business license tax requirements shall submit to the commissioner of the revenue in writing its application for such exemption the application shall set forth specifically the raw materials used in the manufacturing process  a full and complete description of the manufacturing process performed by the business  a detailed description of the product which results from the manufacturing activity  a full and complete description of the method of sale and customers to whom the products are sold  and a specific identification of each location in the city from which sales are made 3 decision the commissioner of the revenue shall stamp on the application the date on which it is received by the commissioner of the revenue within thirty 30 days from such date the commissioner of the revenue shall make and issue to the applicant a written determination about whether the business is a manufacturer entitled to manufacturing exemption 4 manufacturing defined a business constitutes manufacturing for local business license tax purposes if a there is an original material referred to as a raw material  b the business employs a manufacturing process by which the raw materials are changed into an article or a product of substantially different character which results in a transformation of the raw material into a new and different article having a distinctive name character or use it shall be insufficient to establish a change in the material simply because the article is increased in value or in usefulness or simply that the article has been changed as the result of some treatment labor or manipulation  and c a resulting product which is different from the original raw material the commissioner of the revenue shall apply liberally the definitions of manufacturing to effectuate the public policy to encourage manufacturing in the commonwealth 5 sale to qualify for the manufacturing exemption the business must exhibit to the commissioner of the revenue in its application that the resulting products are sold at wholesale at the place of manufacture 6 manufacturing activities in order to qualify for the manufacturing exemption the business must demonstrate in its application that its manufacturing activities are substantial in relation to its nonmanufacturing activities  each location and each business to be separately licensed a separate license shall be required and a separate license tax shall be paid for each definite place of business at which a person engages in a business trade profession occupation or calling subject to a license tax under the provisions of this chapter and for each different business trade profession occupation or calling engaged in at each such definite place of business  person engaged in two or more businesses may elect to obtain one license a person engaged in two 2 or more businesses or professions carried on at the same place of business may elect to obtain one 1 license for all such businesses and professions if all of the following criteria are satisfied a each business or profession is subject to licensure at the location and has satisfied any requirements imposed by state law or other provisions of the ordinances of this jurisdiction  b all of the businesses or professions are subject to the same tax rate or if subject to different tax rates the licensee agrees to be taxed on all businesses and professions at the highest rate  and c the taxpayer agrees to supply such information as the assessor may require concerning the nature of the several businesses and their gross receipts  compliance with chapter  failure to comply is unlawful  injunction against violation a it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in any business trade profession occupation or calling in the city for which a license is required by this chapter without first obtaining from the city the license required by this chapter or to fail neglect or refuse to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter any person who engages in a business in the city without obtaining a license or after being refused a license shall not be relieved of the tax imposed by this chapter b the commissioner of the revenue may institute an action in the appropriate court of record to obtain an injunction for the continuing violation of any provision of this chapter including but not limited to prohibiting any person from continuing to conduct or engage in a business profession trade occupation or calling unless and until the appropriate license has been obtained and the license tax therefor has been paid c the commissioner of the revenue shall cause appropriate summons to be issued and prosecuted for violations of this chapter  failure to comply with this chapter a misdemeanor a except as otherwise provided herein it shall be a class 1 misdemeanor for any person to willfully fail or refuse to file an application for license at the time or times required by this chapter  to willfully fail or refuse to obtain a current license required by this chapter  or to conduct any business trade profession occupation or calling within the city without such license upon conviction for such misdemeanor such person shall be punishable by a fine of not more than two thousand five hundred dollars $250000 b it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in business in the city as a fortuneteller without the license required by this chapter any person violating this subsection shall upon conviction thereof be guilty of a class 3 misdemeanor and shall be punishable by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 c it shall be unlawful for any person to exhibit or give a performance or exhibition in the city of any show carnival or circus without the license required by this chapter any person violating this subsection shall upon conviction thereof be subject to a fine of not less than fifty dollars $5000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each offense  making misleading statements or giving false testimony to obtain license it shall be unlawful for any person to make a false or misleading statement or to give false testimony for the purpose of obtaining a license required by this chapter or for the purpose of assisting or aiding another person to obtain such a license in addition to any penalty that may be imposed because of a violation of this section the license issued in connection with such false or misleading statement or false testimony shall he revoked and no part of the license tax collected in connection therewith shall be refunded  application for license generally  due dates  contents  proof of gross receipts value etc a each person subject to a license tax shall apply for a license prior to beginning business if he was not subject to licensure in the city on or before january 1 of the license year or no later than march 1 of the license year if he had been issued a license for the preceding year the application shall be on forms prescribed by the commissioner of the revenue the application shall state 1 the county or city in which the application is made  2 the definite place of business where the business trade profession occupation or calling is to be pursued  3 the name and trade name of the applicant as such names are registered or reported to the virginia state corporation commission or the local circuit court if so registered or reported  4 the residence address of the applicant  5 whether the applicant is an individual a firm a corporation or other legal entity  6 the name residence address and registered agent if any of each member of the firm if a firm is the applicant and if a corporation or other legal entity is the applicant whether the corporation or other legal entity is a domestic or foreign corporation or other legal entity and if foreign the date of its authority to do business in virginia  7 the nature of the business trade profession occupation or calling for which the application for a license is made  8 the number of years the applicant has pursued in the city such business trade profession occupation or calling  9 a record of the applicants gross receipts verified by oath for the applicants immediately preceding year  and 10 such other information as the commissioner of the revenue may require every application for a license shall have incorporated therein or annexed thereto the affidavit of the applicant stating that the statements and information contained in the application are true and complete if the applicant is i an individual the affidavit must be made by such individual ii a firm the application must be made by one 1 of the members of the firm or iii a corporation or other legal entity the application must be made by an officer having knowledge of the correctness of the statements made and information provided in the application if the license tax imposed on a persons business trade profession occupation or calling is measured by gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like as provided in this chapter the applicant shall make a statement of the amount of such gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like to the commissioner of the revenue who shall thereupon assess such applicant with the proper license tax the commissioner of the revenue may require such statement to be made under oath if the commissioner of the revenue deems it advisable or necessary he may demand of such person such other proof of the amount of his gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like as will enable a satisfactory determination of the same and the commissioner of the revenue may decline to issue any license to such person until such proof has been furnished to the satisfaction of the commissioner of the revenue    4417 issuance of license generally  payment of license tax prerequisite to validity of license upon the filing of an application for license and the assessment of the license tax the commissioner of the revenue if satisfied that the application is complete and correct shall compute and assess the license tax prescribed by law and shall issue a license to the applicant to prosecute the business trade profession occupation or calling therein named such license shall not be valid or effective unless and until the license tax imposed shall have been properly paid if a license can be granted only on the certificate of a court the applicant upon obtaining such certificate shall be entitled to a license the commissioner of the revenue may refuse to issue a license until the applicant has produced evidence satisfactory to the commissioner of the revenue that all delinquent business license personal property meals transient occupancy severance and admission taxes owed by the applicant to the city have been paid  not to issue license for prohibited location no license shall be issued for the conduct of any business trade profession occupation or calling at a location where the conduct of such business trade profession occupation or calling is prohibited by the provisions of this any other ordinance of the city or any other applicable law  contents of license it shall be stated in each license issued with reference to any business trade profession occupation or calling licensed under this chapter that the person to whom such license is issued is thereby licensed to carry on the business trade profession occupation or calling therein named for the license year or for the specific period stated with the application in the case of any license not based on gross receipts if the license tax is measured by the gross receipts of the business the tax shall be paid on or before march 1 b the commissioner of the revenue may grant an extension of time in which to file an application for a license for reasonable cause the extension may be conditioned upon the timely payment of a reasonable estimate of the appropriate license tax  the license tax is then subject to adjustment to the correct tax at the end of the extension together with interest from the due date until the date paid and if the estimate submitted with the extension is found to be unreasonable under the circumstances with a penalty of ten 10 per cent of the portion paid after the due date    4417 computation of license tax for persons beginning business trade profession occupation or calling whenever any person commences a business trade profession occupation or calling after the first day of any license year the license tax imposed by this chapter on such person for such license year shall be measured by such persons good faith estimate of the gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like that will be received made established or produced from the commencement date of the business trade profession occupation or calling to the end of such license year such estimate shall be included in the license application and the license tax imposed on such person for such license year shall be computed thereon such person shall within ninety 90 days after the end of such license year furnish the commissioner of the revenue with the true amount of the gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like for that part of such license year during which such person operated and thereupon shall pay to the treasurer for such license year an additional amount of license tax due based on such true amount of gross receipts gross value sales purchases or the like until such payment is made there shall not be issued to such person any license permitting such person to carry on any business trade profession occupation or calling in the city the commissioner of the revenue shall have the authority to correct an erroneous estimate and to assess such person with any additional license tax found to be due adding thereto any penalty and interest that may be applicable and shall at the same time correct the estimate for the then current license year until a full year of operation shall have been completed in case of an overestimate the taxpayer shall be entitled to a credit upon his license tax payable the following year  proration refund or rebate of tax a in the event a person permanently ceases to engage in a business trade profession occupation or calling within the city during a year for which a license tax based on gross receipts has already been paid the taxpayer shall be entitled upon application to a refund for that portion of the license tax already paid prorated on a monthly basis so as to ensure that the licensed privilege is taxed only for that fraction of the year during which it is exercised within the city the city may remit any refunds in the ensuing fiscal year and may offset against such refund any amount of pastdue taxes owed by the same taxpayer in no event shall the city be required to refund any part of a flat fee or minimum flat tax b unless otherwise provided in this chapter no refund or rebate of a license tax enumerated in this chapter shall be allowed on any license after the license has been issued  calculation of gross receipts the calculation of gross receipts for license tax purposes shall be on either the cash or accrual method  provided however that the method used must coincide with the method of accounting used for federal and state income tax purposes the base years gross receipts may be either the calendar year immediately preceding the license year or the immediately preceding fiscal year used by the business provided that the year employed must coincide with the year used for federal and state income tax purposes  situs of gross receipts a general rule whenever the tax imposed by this ordinance is measured by gross receipts the gross receipts included in the taxable measure shall be only those gross receipts attributed to the exercise of a privilege subject to licensure at a definite place of business within the city in the case of activities conducted outside of a definite place of business such as during a visit to a customer location the gross receipts shall be attributed to the definite place of business from which such activities are initiated directed or controlled the situs of gross receipts for different classifications of business shall be attributed to one or more definite places of business or offices as follows 1 the gross receipts of a contractor shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which his services are performed or if his services are not performed at any definite place of business then the definite place of business from which his services are directed or controlled unless the contractor is subject to the provisions of of the virginia  2 the gross receipts of a retailer or wholesaler shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which sales solicitation activities occur or if sales solicitation activities do not occur at any definite place of business then the definite place of business from which sales solicitation activities are directed or controlled  however a wholesaler or distribution house subject to a license tax measured by purchases shall determine the situs of its purchases by the definite place of business at which or from which deliveries of the purchased goods wares and merchandise are made to customers any wholesaler who is subject to license tax in two 2 or more localities and who is subject to multiple taxation because the localities use different measures may apply to the department of taxation for a determination as to the proper measure of purchases and gross receipts subject to license tax in each locality  3 the gross receipts of a business renting tangible personal property shall be attributed to the definite place of business from which the tangible personal property is rented or if the property is not rented from any definite place of business then to the definite place of business at which the rental of such property is managed  and 4 the gross receipts from the performance of services shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which the services are performed or if not performed at any definite place of business then to the definite place of business from which the services are directed or controlled b apportionment if the licensee has more than one definite place of business and it is impractical or impossible to determine to which definite place of business gross receipts should be attributed under the general rule the gross receipts of the business shall be apportioned between the definite places of businesses on the basis of payroll gross receipts shall not be apportioned to a definite place of business unless some activities under the applicable general rule occurred at or were controlled from such definite place of business gross receipts attributable to a definite place of business in another jurisdiction shall not be attributed to the city solely because the other jurisdiction does not impose a tax on the gross receipts attributable to the definite place of business in such other jurisdiction c agreements the commissioner of the revenue may enter into agreements with any other political subdivision of virginia concerning the manner in which gross receipts shall be apportioned among definite places of business however the sum of the gross receipts apportioned by the agreement shall not exceed the total gross receipts attributable to all of the definite places of business affected by the agreement upon being notified by a taxpayer that its method of attributing gross receipts is fundamentally inconsistent with the method of one or more political subdivisions in which the taxpayer is licensed to engage in business and that the difference has or is likely to result in taxes on more than one hundred 100 per cent of its gross receipts from all locations in the affected jurisdictions the commissioner of the revenue shall make a good faith effort to reach an apportionment agreement with the other political subdivisions involved if an agreement cannot be reached either the commissioner of the revenue or taxpayer may seek an advisory opinion from the department of taxation pursuant to of the virginia  notice of the request shall be given to the other party notwithstanding the provisions of of the virginia when a taxpayer has demonstrated to a court that two 2 or more political subdivisions of virginia have assessed taxes on gross receipts that may create a double assessment within the meaning of of the virginia the court shall enter such orders pending resolution of the litigation as may be necessary to ensure that the taxpayer is not required to pay multiple assessments even though it is not then known which assessment is correct and which is erroneous  penalty and interest a a penalty of ten 10 per cent of the license tax is hereby imposed upon the failure to file an application or the failure to pay the tax by the appropriate due date only the late filing penalty shall be imposed by the commissioner of the revenue if both the application and payment are late  however both penalties may be assessed if the commissioner of the revenue determines that the taxpayer has a history of noncompliance in the case of an assessment of additional tax made by the commissioner of the revenue if the application and if applicable the return were made in good faith and the understatement of the tax was not due to any fraud reckless or intentional disregard of the law by the taxpayer there shall be no late payment penalty assessed with the additional tax if any assessment of tax by the commissioner of the revenue is not paid within thirty 30 days the treasurer or other collecting official may impose a ten 10 per cent late payment penalty if the failure to file or pay was not the fault of the taxpayer the penalties shall not be imposed or if imposed shall be abated by the official who assessed them in order to demonstrate lack of fault the taxpayer must show that he acted responsibly and that the failure was due to events beyond his control acted responsibly means that i the taxpayer exercised the level of reasonable care that a prudent person would exercise under the circumstances in determining the filing obligations for the business and ii the taxpayer undertook significant steps to avoid or mitigate the failure such as requesting appropriate extensions where applicable attempting to prevent a foreseeable impediment acting to remove an impediment once it occurred and promptly rectifying a failure once the impediment was removed or the failure discovered events beyond the taxpayers control include but are not limited to the unavailability of records due to fire or other casualty  the unavoidable absence eg due to death or serious illness of the person with the sole responsibility for tax compliance  or the taxpayers reasonable reliance in good faith upon erroneous written information from the commissioner of the revenue who was aware of the relevant facts relating to the taxpayers business when he provided the erroneous information b interest shall be charged on the late payment of the tax from the due date until the date paid without regard to fault or other reason for the late payment whenever an assessment of additional or omitted tax by the commissioner of the revenue is found to be erroneous all interest and penalty charged and collected on the amount of the assessment found to be erroneous shall be refunded together with interest on the refund from the date of payment or the due date whichever is later interest shall be paid on the refund of any license tax from the date of payment or due date whichever is later whether attributable to an amended return or other reason interest on any refund shall be paid at the same rate charged under of the virginia no interest shall accrue on an adjustment of estimated tax liability to actual liability at the conclusion of a base year no interest shall be paid on a refund or charged on a late payment provided the refund or the late payment is made not more than thirty days from the date of the payment that created the refund or the due date of the tax whichever is later  general powers of treasurer to collect tax the city treasurer shall have the same powers to enforce the collection of license taxes that are not given or may hereafter be given unto the commissioners of the revenue by the applicable provisions of the virginia for the enforcement of state licenses  assessment of additional tax whenever the commissioner of the revenue ascertains that any person should be assessed with other or any additional license tax pursuant to the provisions of this chapter he shall assess such person with such additional license tax as he may ascertain to be due  display of license every person required by this chapter to pay a license tax or to obtain any license tag sticker or sign under the provisions of this chapter shall display the license tag sticker or sign in a conspicuous place at his regular place of business or profession in order that any authorized representative of the city may inspect the same at any and all reasonable times any licensee under this chapter who does not maintain a regular place of business shall either carry the license tag sticker or sign with him on his person or have the same fixed or attached to his truck automobile or motor vehicle and properly display the same when called upon to do so by any authorized representative of the city no license measured by volume of business shall be required to be publicly displayed  transfer of licenses licenses issued under this chapter shall not be transferable  recordkeeping and audits every person who is assessable with a license tax shall keep sufficient records to enable the commissioner of the revenue to verify the correctness of the tax paid for the license years assessable and to enable the commissioner of the revenue to ascertain what is the correct amount of tax that was assessable for each of those years all such records books of accounts and other information shall be open to inspection and examination by the commissioner of the revenue in order to allow the commissioner of the revenue to establish whether a particular receipt is directly attributable to the taxable privilege exercised within the city the commissioner of the revenue shall provide the taxpayer with the option to conduct the audit in the taxpayers local business office if the records are maintained there in the event the records are maintained outside the city copies of the appropriate books and records shall be sent to the commissioner of the revenues office upon demand  procedure when application for license not made or tax not paid if any person fails or refuses to file an application for license or to pay the license tax imposed by this chapter the commissioner of the revenue shall proceed in such manner as the commissioner of the revenue deems best to obtain facts and information on which to base an estimate of the tax due as soon as the commissioner of the revenue has secured such facts and information the commissioner of the revenue shall proceed to determine and assess against such person the license tax penalty and interest provided for in this chapter and shall notify such person of the amount of such tax penalty and interest the total amount shall be due and payable within ten 10 days of the date of such notice the commissioner of the revenue shall have the power to examine such records for the purpose of administering and enforcing the provisions of this chapter as provided by law  limitations and extensions a where before the expiration of the time prescribed for the assessment of any license tax imposed pursuant to this ordinance both the commissioner of the revenue and the taxpayer have consented in writing to its assessment after such time the tax may be assessed at any time prior to the expiration of the period agreed upon the period so agreed upon may be extended by subsequent agreements in writing made before the expiration of the period previously agreed upon b notwithstanding of the virginia the commissioner of the revenue shall assess the local license tax omitted because of fraud or failure to apply for a license for the current license year and the six 6 preceding license years c the period for collecting any license tax shall not expire prior to the period specified in of the virginia two 2 years after the date of assessment if the period for assessment has been extended pursuant to this subdivision of the ordinance two 2 years after the final determination of an appeal for which collection has been stayed pursuant to sections 1432b or 1432d of this chapter or two 2 years after the final decision in a court application pursuant to of the virginia or similar law for which collection has been stayed whichever is later  appeals and rulings a any person assessed with a license tax as a result of an audit may apply within ninety 90 days from the date of such assessment to the commissioner of the revenue for a correction of the assessment the application must be filed in good faith and sufficiently identify the taxpayer audit period remedy sought each alleged error in the assessment the grounds upon which the taxpayer relies and any other facts relevant to the taxpayers contention the commissioner of the revenue may hold a conference with the taxpayer if requested by the taxpayer or require submission of additional information and documents a further audit or other evidence deemed necessary for a proper and equitable determination of the application the assessment shall be deemed prima facie correct the commissioner of the revenue shall undertake a full review of the taxpayers claims and issue a determination to the taxpayer setting forth its position every assessment pursuant to an audit shall be accompanied by a written explanation of the taxpayers right to seek correction and the specific procedure to be followed in the jurisdiction eg the name and address to which an application should be directed b provided a timely and complete application is made collection activity shall be suspended until a final determination is issued by the commissioner of the revenue unless the treasurer determines that collection would be jeopardized by delay or that the taxpayer has not responded to a request for relevant information after a reasonable time interest shall accrue in accordance with the provisions of section 1424b but no further penalty shall be imposed while collection action is suspended the term jeopardized by delay includes a finding that the application is frivolous or that a taxpayer desires to i depart quickly from the city ii remove his property therefrom iii conceal himself or his property therein or iv do any other act tending to prejudice or to render wholly or partially ineffectual proceedings to collect the tax for the period in question c any person assessed with a local license tax as a result of an audit may apply within ninety days of the determination by the commissioner of the revenue on an application pursuant to section 1432a to the tax commissioner for a correction of such assessment the tax commissioner shall issue a determination to the taxpayer within ninety 90 days of receipt of the taxpayers application unless the taxpayer and the commissioner of the revenue are notified that a longer period will be required the application shall be treated as an application pursuant to of the virginia and the tax commissioner may issue an order correcting such assessment pursuant to of the virginia following such an order either the taxpayer or the commissioner of the revenue may apply to the appropriate circuit court pursuant to of the virginia however the burden shall be on the party making the application to show that the ruling of the tax commissioner is erroneous neither the tax commissioner nor the department of taxation shall be made a party to an application to correct an assessment merely because the tax commissioner has ruled on it d on receipt of a notice of intent to file an appeal to the tax commissioner under section 1432c the treasurer shall further suspend collection activity until a final determination is issued by the tax commissioner unless the treasurer determines that collection would be jeopardized by delay or that the taxpayer has not responded to a request for relevant information after a reasonable time interest shall accrue in accordance with the provisions of section 1424b but no further penalty shall be imposed while collection action is suspended the term jeopardized by delay shall have the same meaning as set forth in section 1432b above e any taxpayer may request a written ruling regarding the application of a local license tax to a specific situation from the commissioner of the revenue any person requesting such a ruling must provide all the relevant facts for the situation and may present a rationale for the basis of an interpretation of the law most favorable to the taxpayer any misrepresentation or change in the applicable law or the factual situation as presented in the ruling request shall invalidate any such ruling issued a written ruling may be revoked or amended prospectively if i there is a change in the law a court decision or the guidelines issued by the department of taxation upon which the ruling was based or ii the commissioner of the revenue notifies the taxpayer of a change in the policy or interpretation upon which the ruling was based however any person who acts on a written ruling which later becomes invalid shall be deemed to have acted in good faith during the period in which such ruling was in effect  secs 14331437  reserved article ii of policy it is hereby declared to be the public policy of manassas park to protect its citizens against excessive noise that is detrimental to life health and enjoyment of property in order to promote the public health safety welfare and the peace and quiet of the inhabitants of the city the following measurements and standards relating to noise are hereby adopted  11600 violations of chapter any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a class 2 misdemeanor  11600 definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the has the same meaning as found in section 462100 of the virginia nighttime means those times excluded from the definition of daytime noise means any steadystate or impulsive sound occurring on either a continuous or intermittent basis noise disturbance means any sound which 1 endangers or injures the safety or health of humans  or 2 endangers or injures personal or real property  or 3 exceeds the applicable maximum permissible sound levels as they appear in the table in section 154 sound level meter means an instrument to measure sound pressure levels that meets or exceeds performance
